revised_title: A New Method for Quantitative Analysis of Incomplete Color Blindness
tldr: The author presents a simple test to quantify the amount of green and red sensations in incomplete color-blind eyes compared to a normal eye. The test uses a chromate solution and a color patch apparatus to determine the scale number of the ray, which can then be referred to a diagram to calculate the amount of green and red sensation present in the incomplete color-blind eye.
